titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tri-State Conference on Manufacturing Records, 1978-1993 AIS.1993.10
titlestmt.author: Zachary Brodt.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:36:48 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Tri-State Conference on Manufacturing was founded in 1979 as the Tri-State Conference on Steel, which was a coalition of labor unions and activists that fought the effects of deindustrialization. The group created or became involved in several regional projects concerning unemployment and plant closures, such as the Steel Valley Authority. This collection includes correspondence, newsletters, and meeting minutes regarding the activities of the Tri-State Council on Steel and Manufacturing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Tri-State Conference on Manufacturing, Board of Directors, on August 3, 1993 and December 13, 1994.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Tri-State Conference on Manufacturing was founded in 1979 as the Tri-State Conference on Steel, which was a coalition of labor unions and activists that fought the effects of deindustrialization. The organization created the Steel Valley Authority, which sought to publicly own closed mills through the use of eminent domain, as a means of keeping mills open and thousands of steelworkers on the job. Members were also involved in several regional projects concerning unemployment and plant closures. Tri-State also played an integral role in the grassroots movement to save Dorothy Six, a blast furnace at the US Steel Duquesne Works. The group supported bringing a MAGLEV train to Pittsburgh as a means of solving transportation and employment problems in the area.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Tri-State Conference on Manufacturing Records, 1982-1993, AIS.1993.10, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tri-State Conference on Manufacturing Records, 1982-1993, AIS.1993.10, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was inventoried at the folder level by Zachary Brodt in June 2010.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection includes correspondence, newsletters, and meeting minutes regarding the activities of the Tri-State Council on Steel and Manufacturing. Newspaper and magazine clippings concerning plant closures and the steel industry comprise a large portion of the collection. Also included are financial and fundraising records, as well as research material and reports.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Oversized materials can be found in cabinet drawers 5-4 and 5-5.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Denominational Ministry Strategy Collection, 1973-1995, AIS.1989.07, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

Mon Valley Unemployed Committee Records, 1980-1995, AIS.2002.02, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System
